---



---


Fixed the hero content centering. The `.hero-content-center` container had `width: 100%`, which made it span the full width and prevented proper centering despite flex centering on the parent.

**What I changed:**
- Updated `.hero-content-center` to use `width: auto` on desktop (≥1024px) so the parent's `justify-content: center` can center it
- Kept `width: 100%` on smaller screens for mobile responsiveness
- The container now centers while respecting the `max-width: 1200px` constraint

The hero content text should now be centered in the viewport on desktop while staying responsive on mobile. The flexbox parent (`.hero-content-overlay`) centers the content container, and the text remains centered within it.

Fixing the centering: the hero section extends full-width under the sidebar, but content should be centered in the visible area. Adjusting the overlay to account for the sidebar:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

Lines added: 15, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -333,4 +333,19 @@
    }
  
+   /* Center content in visible viewport (accounting for sidebar) */
+   @media (min-width: 1024px) {
+     .hero-content-overlay {
+       padding-left: calc(280px + 3rem + 2rem);
+       padding-right: 2rem;
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   @media (min-width: 769px) and (max-width: 1023px) {
+     .hero-content-overlay {
+       padding-left: calc(260px + 2rem + 2rem);
+       padding-right: 2rem;
+     }
+   }
+ 
  
    .hero-content-center {
```

---



---


Fixed the hero content centering. Summary:

## Analysis & Fix

**The Problem:**
- The hero section uses a negative left margin to extend under the sidebar (280px + 3rem)
- The content overlay was centering in the full viewport width, not the visible area
- This made the content appear left of center

**The Solution:**
1. Added left padding to `.hero-content-overlay` equal to the sidebar width on desktop
   - Desktop (≥1024px): `padding-left: calc(280px + 3rem)`
   - Tablet (769-1023px): `padding-left: calc(260px + 2rem)`
2. This shifts the flex container’s content area to start where the visible area begins
3. Flexbox then centers within the visible area (viewport minus sidebar)

**Result:**
- Hero content is centered in the visible viewport area (excluding the sidebar)
- Mobile responsiveness is preserved (existing mobile styles override these)
- Text alignment remains centered within the content container

The content should now be centered in the visible area of the viewport. Check the page to confirm.

---

---



---


Fixing the asymmetric padding that prevents proper centering. Using a transform-based approach to center content within the visible viewport:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: src/pages/index.astro</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: undefined, lines removed: 16

```diff
@@ -332,20 +332,4 @@
      margin: 0;
    }
- 
-   /* Center content in visible viewport (accounting for sidebar) */
-   @media (min-width: 1024px) {
-     .hero-content-overlay {
-       padding-left: calc(280px + 3rem);
-       padding-right: 2rem;
-     }
-   }
- 
-   @media (min-width: 769px) and (max-width: 1023px) {
-     .hero-content-overlay {
-       padding-left: calc(260px + 2rem);
-       padding-right: 2rem;
-     }
-   }
- 
  
    .hero-content-center {
```

**Chunk 2**
Lines added: 9, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -363,7 +347,16 @@
    }
    
+   /* Center content in visible viewport (accounting for sidebar) */
    @media (min-width: 1024px) {
      .hero-content-center {
        width: auto;
+       transform: translateX(calc((280px + 3rem) / 2));
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   @media (min-width: 769px) and (max-width: 1023px) {
+     .hero-content-center {
+       width: auto;
+       transform: translateX(calc((260px + 2rem) / 2));
      }
    }
```

</details>

</tool-use>

<tool-use data-tool-type="generic" data-tool-name="todo_write">
<details><summary>Tool use: **todo_write** • Todo List</summary>

- [x] Fixed hero content centering by removing translateX(-50%) from hero animations

- [x] Test that mobile responsiveness is maintained

---



---


## Root cause
The `fadeInUp` animation used `translateX(-50%)`, which shifted hero content left. That was fine for the scroll indicator (which uses `left: 50%`), but not for the hero text.

## Solution applied

1. Created a separate animation for hero content:
   - Added `fadeInUpHero` that only uses `translateY` (no horizontal movement)
   - Updated hero-title, hero-subtitle, hero-description, and hero-cta to use `fadeInUpHero`
   - Kept the original `fadeInUp` for the scroll indicator

2. Maintained the transform offset:
   - Kept `transform: translateX(calc((280px + 3rem) / 2))` on `.hero-content-center` to account for the sidebar
   - This centers the content in the visible viewport area (excluding the sidebar)

## Result
- Hero content is centered horizontally in the visible viewport
- Text alignment is centered
- Buttons are centered
- Animation only affects vertical movement
- Responsive across screen sizes

The hero content should now be properly centered. The animation no longer causes left alignment.

---

_**User (2025-11-13 04:58Z)**_



---

_**Agent (model default, mode Agent)**_



---


Hero content is now centered.

From the image:
- Title, subtitle, and description are horizontally centered
- CTA buttons are centered
- Content is positioned correctly in the visible area, accounting for the sidebar

## What Fixed It:

1. **Removed `translateX(-50%)` from hero animations** — Created `fadeInUpHero` to only animate vertically, removing the horizontal shift causing left alignment
2. **Added transform offset for sidebar** — Used `transform: translateX(calc((280px + 3rem) / 2))` to center content in the visible viewport area (excluding the sidebar space)

The hero section now displays centered content with smooth fade-in animations and proper alignment across screen sizes.

---



---


Removed the sidebar offset transforms from the hero section. The content is now centered in the full viewport since the sidebar is hidden.

**What changed:**
- Removed `transform: translateX(calc((280px + 3rem) / 2))` that was shifting content right for the sidebar
- Removed the tablet version transform as well
- Content now uses flexbox centering from the parent `.hero-content-overlay` (which has `justify-content: center`)

The hero content is centered in the full viewport, without accounting for sidebar space. The flexbox centering handles it.
